newsitem.title: USA: ABC to unveil 24-hour online news service.
newsitem.headline: ABC to unveil 24-hour online news service.

text.p: ABC News said it will unveil Thursday its foray into the Internet news arena with ABC.news.com, a 24-hour online news service squarely aimed at competing with MSNBC, the joint venture of NBC and Microsoft Corp..

Last month, ABC, a unit of Walt Disney Co., formed a few formidable partnerships as part of this move, including a deal with America Online Inc., Netscape Communications Corp. and invested $100 million in Starwave Corp., acquiring a third of the firm which runs popular sites such as Mr. Showbiz and NBA.com.
The service will be free and supported by advertising.
Analysts said while ABC News is behind MSNBC, which was launched by Microsoft and NBC last July, ABC can learn from some of the trials of competing online news services.

"It's a bit late, but in the Internet business, there is no such thing as too late when you have a big brand," said Gary Arlen, president of Arlen Communications in Bethesda, Md. "And to someone who just discovered cyberspace on Friday, they won't know ABC just started and MSNBC and CNN have been there," Arlen added. CNN also has a 24-hour online news site.
